dir-section.heading: Education
dir-section.p: Primary education is free and compulsory for all children between the ages of six and 15 years. Minority languages are used in schools in ethnically mixed regions. Various types of secondary education, beginning at the age of 15 and lasting between two and five years, are also available. In 2019/20 enrolment in pre-primary education was equivalent to 94.0% of children in the relevant age-group, and in 2021/22 enrolment in primary education included 98.8% of children in the appropriate age-group. Total enrolment at lower secondary level in 2021/22 included 98.7% of those in the relevant age-group, and at upper secondary level included 96.6% of those in the relevant age-group. There are four universities. In 2021 expenditure on education was equivalent to 11.5% of total government expenditure.
